pages.title: Best Biryani in Delhi — Where Locals Actually Go
pages.contentDirection: The best biryani in Delhi ranges from Al Jawahar near Jama Masjid to Dum Pukht at ITC Maurya. Prices from ₹200 to ₹3,000 with local picks.

pages.title: Best Cafes in Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Delhi's best cafes include Indian Coffee House in CP (historic), Blue Tokai (specialty coffee), Kunzum Travel Cafe in Hauz Khas, and Triveni Terrace Cafe.

pages.title: Best Cooking Classes in Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Delhi cooking classes cost ₹2,000-5,000 and include home kitchen experiences, professional workshops, and market tour combos. Here's where to book.

pages.title: Best Free Things to Do in Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Gurudwara Bangla Sahib, Lodhi Gardens, Lodhi Art District, India Gate, and Sunder Nursery are all free. Here are Delhi's best no-cost experiences.

pages.title: Best Museums in Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Explore Delhi's best museums including the free National Museum, Crafts Museum, Partition Museum, and Gandhi Smriti. Visitor tips inside.

pages.title: Best Nightlife in Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Hauz Khas Village for bars and clubs, Connaught Place for lounges, Cyber Hub Gurgaon for upscale drinks. Most venues close by 1am.

pages.title: Best Photography Spots in Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Humayun's Tomb at golden hour, Lodhi Art District murals, and Chandni Chowk street scenes — here are Delhi's top photography locations.

pages.title: Best Places to Buy Clothes in Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Budget fashion at Sarojini Nagar, mid-range at Select Citywalk and Khan Market, designer labels in Hauz Khas Village. Where to shop by price range.

pages.title: Best Restaurants in Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Delhi's best restaurants include Indian Accent for fine dining, Bukhara for dal makhani, Karim's for Mughlai, and SodaBottleOpenerWala for Parsi food.

pages.title: Best SIM Card for Tourists in Delhi (2026)
pages.contentDirection: Get an Airtel or Jio SIM at Delhi airport for ₹500-700 ($6-8.50) including data. You'll need a passport photo and copy. Activation takes 2-24 hours.

pages.title: Best Time To Visit Delhi for Festivals
pages.contentDirection: October to March is ideal for Delhi festivals — Dussehra, Diwali, Republic Day, and Holi. Month-by-month festival calendar included.

pages.title: Best Weekend Trips from Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Agra, Jaipur, Rishikesh, Neemrana Fort, Mathura, Bharatpur, and Jim Corbett are the top weekend getaways from Delhi. Distances, costs, and what to do.

pages.title: Bollywood Experience in Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Watch a Bollywood film at PVR for ₹300-700, take a dance class, or visit Kingdom of Dreams in Gurgaon. Here's how to get your Bollywood fix.

pages.title: Can You Do a Cycling Tour in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Yes — Delhi By Cycle runs early morning rides through Old Delhi starting at 6am for ₹1,500-2,000 before traffic hits. Here's how to book.

pages.title: Can You Do a Day Trip from Delhi to Agra?
pages.contentDirection: Yes, a Delhi to Agra day trip takes 3-4 hours each way by road or 1hr 40min by Gatimaan Express. Leave early, see the Taj, return by evening.

pages.title: Can You Do a Day Trip from Delhi to Jaipur?
pages.contentDirection: Possible but exhausting — Jaipur is 5-6 hours from Delhi by road. The Shatabdi Express takes 4.5 hours. An overnight trip is far more practical.

pages.title: Can You Drink Tap Water in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: No. Never drink tap water in Delhi. Stick to sealed bottled water or RO-filtered water in restaurants. Avoid ice from street stalls. Here's what's safe.

pages.title: Day Trip to Mathura & Vrindavan From Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Visit Krishna's birthplace on a day trip from Delhi. Mathura and Vrindavan are 3 hours away with temples, ghats, and street food. Best during Holi.

pages.title: Best Day Trips From Delhi — 2026 Guide
pages.contentDirection: Day trips from Delhi to Agra, Jaipur, Neemrana, and Mathura. Train times, costs from ₹750, and what to see on each trip.

pages.title: Delhi Metro Map & Tips for Tourists (2026)
pages.contentDirection: Delhi Metro fares run ₹10-60 per ride. Key stations: Rajiv Chowk for CP, Chandni Chowk for Old Delhi, Hauz Khas for South Delhi nightlife.

pages.title: Diwali in Delhi — What To Expect
pages.contentDirection: Experience Diwali in Delhi: decorated markets, fireworks, sweets, temple visits, and honest air quality advice. Tips for tourists.

pages.title: Do I Need a Visa for India?
pages.contentDirection: Most nationalities need an e-visa for India. Apply online at indianvisaonline.gov.in at least 4 days before travel. 30-day tourist e-visas start at $25.

pages.title: Do I Need To Tip in Delhi? — Tipping Guide
pages.contentDirection: Tip 10% at Delhi restaurants if there's no service charge. Round up for auto drivers. Give ₹50-100 to guides. Full tipping guide.

pages.title: Best Experiences In Delhi — 2026 Guide
pages.contentDirection: Beyond sightseeing: cooking classes, cycling tours, street art walks, and Sufi music in Delhi. Prices from ₹500 with booking details.

pages.title: Best Food Tours In Delhi — 2026
pages.contentDirection: Compare Delhi's best food tours from ₹1,500. Old Delhi street food walks, cooking class combos, and market tours with prices and booking info.

pages.title: Best Heritage Walks In Delhi — 2026
pages.contentDirection: Guided and self-guided heritage walks in Delhi covering 174 ASI monuments and 3 UNESCO sites. Routes, prices from ₹500, and practical tips.

pages.title: How Do I Get From Delhi Airport to the City?
pages.contentDirection: Take the Airport Express Metro for ₹60 ($0.72) in 20 minutes to New Delhi station. Uber costs ₹300-500. Prepaid taxis ₹400-600. Full transport guide.

pages.title: How Long Do You Need at Red Fort?
pages.contentDirection: Plan 1.5 to 2 hours for Red Fort, plus 30 minutes if you visit the museum. Combine it with Chandni Chowk and Jama Masjid for a full Old Delhi morning.

pages.title: How Many Days Do You Need in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: You need 2-3 days minimum for Delhi's top sights, or 4-5 days to explore food, neighbourhoods, and day trips. Here's what each timeframe covers.

pages.title: How Many Heritage Sites Are in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Delhi has 174 ASI-protected monuments and 3 UNESCO World Heritage Sites — more than any other Indian city. Here's what that means for your visit.

pages.title: How Much Does a Food Tour Cost in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Delhi food tours cost ₹1,500-3,500 ($18-42) for group tours with 8-12 tastings over 3-4 hours. Private tours run ₹3,000-6,000. Here's what to expect.

pages.title: How Much Money Do I Need Per Day in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Budget ₹2,000-3,000 ($24-36) per day for hostels and street food. Mid-range ₹5,000-10,000. Luxury ₹15,000+. Here's exactly where that money goes.

pages.title: How Old Is Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Delhi has been inhabited since at least the 6th century BC, making it roughly 2,500 years old. Seven historic cities were built here across ten dynasties.

pages.title: How To Avoid Scams in Delhi — Tourist Guide
pages.contentDirection: The biggest Delhi scams: fake tourist offices, the 'hotel is closed' taxi trick, and gem shop hustles. Here's how to spot and avoid every one of them.

pages.title: How To Get Around Delhi — Transport Guide
pages.contentDirection: The Delhi Metro is the best way to get around. Uber and Ola work for door-to-door trips. Auto rickshaws handle short hops — agree on a fare first.

pages.title: How To Get From Delhi to Agra — 2026 Guide
pages.contentDirection: Get from Delhi to Agra by Gatimaan Express (1hr 40min, ₹750-1,500), private car (3-4 hours, ₹3,000-4,000), or Shatabdi train. Full 2026 comparison.

pages.title: How to Spend 1 Day in Delhi
pages.contentDirection: One day in Delhi covers Red Fort, Chandni Chowk, Humayun's Tomb, Lodhi Gardens, and Connaught Place. Here's a realistic hour-by-hour itinerary.

pages.title: How to Spend 3 Days in Delhi
pages.contentDirection: A day-by-day Delhi itinerary covering Old Delhi, New Delhi monuments, and South Delhi experiences. Practical routes, timings, and costs included.

pages.title: How To Use the Delhi Metro — Step by Step
pages.contentDirection: Buy a token or Metro smart card at any station, pass through the security check, and board. Here's everything you need to know about riding Delhi's Metro.

pages.title: Humayun's Tomb vs Taj Mahal
pages.contentDirection: Humayun's Tomb came first (1570) and inspired the Taj Mahal (1653). It's smaller, far less crowded, and better for photography. Here's how they compare.

pages.title: Is 2 Days Enough for Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Two days covers Delhi's top highlights like Red Fort and Humayun's Tomb, but you'll miss the deeper food and neighbourhood experiences. Here's how to plan.

pages.title: Is Bargaining Expected in Delhi Markets?
pages.contentDirection: Yes, bargaining is standard in Delhi's street markets. Start at 50% of the asking price and negotiate from there. Here's where and how to do it.

pages.title: Is Delhi Expensive?
pages.contentDirection: Delhi is cheap by Western standards. Budget travellers can get by on ₹2,000-3,000 ($24-36) a day. Mid-range costs ₹5,000-10,000. Here's the full breakdown.

pages.title: Is Delhi Polluted? — Air Quality Guide (2026)
pages.contentDirection: Yes, Delhi has serious air pollution, especially November to January when AQI exceeds 300. Check AQI daily and carry an N95 mask.

pages.title: Is Delhi Safe at Night?
pages.contentDirection: Parts of Delhi are safe at night — South Delhi, Connaught Place, and Khan Market are well-lit and busy after dark. Here's where to go and where to avoid.

pages.title: Is Delhi Safe for Solo Female Travellers?
pages.contentDirection: Delhi is manageable for solo female travellers with precautions. Use women's metro carriages, Uber/Ola at night, and stay alert.

pages.title: Is Delhi Safe for Tourists?
pages.contentDirection: Delhi is generally safe for tourists. Petty theft and scams are the main risks, not violent crime. Practical safety tips inside.

pages.title: Is Delhi Vegetarian Friendly?
pages.contentDirection: Delhi is extremely vegetarian friendly. Most restaurants have extensive veg menus, and many are exclusively 'pure veg.' Here's what to eat and where.

pages.title: Is Delhi Worth Visiting?
pages.contentDirection: Yes, Delhi is worth visiting — but it's not an easy city. Expect sensory overload, incredible food, Mughal monuments, and chaos. Here's what to know.

pages.title: Is Khan Market Expensive?
pages.contentDirection: Khan Market is India's priciest retail area, but it's worth visiting for bookshops, cafes, and boutiques. Here's what things actually cost.

pages.title: Is Neemrana Fort Worth Visiting From Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Yes. Neemrana Fort Palace is a 2-hour drive from Delhi with zip-lining, a stunning pool, and Rajasthani food. Day visit or overnight options from ₹3,000.

pages.title: Is Qutub Minar Worth Visiting?
pages.contentDirection: Yes. The 73-metre Qutub Minar is a 12th-century tower with stunning carvings, and the surrounding complex is equally impressive. Entry is ₹35/₹550.

pages.title: Is Red Fort Worth Visiting?
pages.contentDirection: Yes, but go early — Red Fort opens at 9:30 AM and gets crowded by 11. Skip Mondays. Entry is ₹35 Indians, ₹500 foreigners. Here's how to make it count.

pages.title: Is Street Food Safe in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Delhi street food is mostly safe if you eat at busy stalls with high turnover. Avoid pre-cut fruit and tap water ice. Tips here.

pages.title: Is There a Pub Crawl in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Yes — organised pub crawls run in CP and Hauz Khas, or DIY your own in Hauz Khas Village where 15+ bars sit within walking distance.

pages.title: Is Uber Available in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Yes — Uber and Ola both operate across Delhi. Download both apps and get an Indian SIM for OTP verification. Rides cost ₹100-400 across the city.

pages.title: Best Markets In Delhi — Shopping Guide 2026
pages.contentDirection: Delhi's best markets from Chandni Chowk to Khan Market. What each sells, price ranges, bargaining tips, and how to get there by metro.

pages.title: Paharganj — Is It Worth Staying?
pages.contentDirection: Paharganj is Delhi's cheapest backpacker area with rooms from ₹500/night — but it's chaotic and gritty. Honest pros, cons, and alternatives.

pages.title: Romantic Things To Do in Delhi for Couples
pages.contentDirection: Lodhi Gardens sunset, Indian Accent dinner, Sunder Nursery walks, Champa Gali evenings, and rooftop dining — Delhi's best date spots.

pages.title: Self-Guided Walking Tour of Old Delhi
pages.contentDirection: A 3-4 hour self-guided walking tour from Chandni Chowk Metro to Jama Masjid. Route map, food stops, distances, and practical tips for 2026.

pages.title: Things To Do in Connaught Place — Area Guide
pages.contentDirection: Connaught Place offers Agrasen ki Baoli, Jantar Mantar, top restaurants, and Delhi's best nightlife. Walkable and metro-connected.

pages.title: Things to Do in Delhi at Night
pages.contentDirection: India Gate illuminated, CP dinner strip, Hauz Khas nightlife, Old Delhi night food walks, and Akshardham fountain show — Delhi after dark.

pages.title: Things To Do in Delhi in Summer
pages.contentDirection: Beat 45°C heat with AC museums, mall escapes, cooking classes, and water parks. Plus why Delhi's summer low season saves you serious money.

pages.title: Things To Do in Delhi in Winter
pages.contentDirection: Lodhi Gardens walks, Old Delhi food tours, Republic Day parade, Surajkund Mela, and daulat ki chaat — Delhi's best season, fully explained.

pages.title: Things To Do in Delhi When It Rains
pages.contentDirection: Museums, cooking classes, mall-hopping, and indoor monuments — how to make the most of Delhi's monsoon season from July to September.

pages.title: Things to Do in Delhi With Kids
pages.contentDirection: National Science Centre, Delhi Zoo, Rail Museum, and Adventure Island — most charge under ₹200 entry. Here's what works for families.

pages.title: Things To Do in Hauz Khas — Area Guide
pages.contentDirection: Hauz Khas has 13th-century ruins, Deer Park, boutique shopping, and Delhi's densest concentration of bars. Here's what to see and where to go.

pages.title: Things To Do in Karol Bagh, Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Karol Bagh has budget shopping on Ajmal Khan Road, great street food, Gaffar Market electronics, and affordable hotels. Full neighbourhood guide.

pages.title: Things To Do in Nizamuddin, Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Nizamuddin has a 700-year-old Sufi shrine, Thursday night qawwali, Humayun's Tomb, and some of Delhi's best kebabs. Here's what to see and do.

pages.title: Things To Do in Old Delhi & Chandni Chowk
pages.contentDirection: Red Fort, Jama Masjid, Paranthe Wali Gali, spice markets, and cycle rickshaws — here's everything to do in Old Delhi and Chandni Chowk.

pages.title: Things To Do in South Delhi — Area Guide
pages.contentDirection: South Delhi has Qutub Minar, Lodhi Gardens, Khan Market, and top galleries. It's greener, calmer, and more spread out than Old Delhi.

pages.title: What Are the 7 Cities of Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Delhi's seven historic cities span from Lal Kot (1060) to Shahjahanabad (1638). Each was built by a different dynasty, and ruins of all seven still stand.

pages.title: Best Markets in Delhi for Shopping
pages.contentDirection: Chandni Chowk, Khan Market, Sarojini Nagar, Dilli Haat, and Janpath are Delhi's top markets. Here's what to buy at each and how to get there.

pages.title: UNESCO World Heritage Sites in Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Delhi has three UNESCO sites: Red Fort, Humayun's Tomb, and Qutub Minar. Here's what to expect at each, with entry fees, timings, and tips.

pages.title: What Currency Does Delhi Use? — Money Guide
pages.contentDirection: Delhi uses the Indian Rupee (INR/₹). ATMs are everywhere, cards work at most restaurants and shops. Carry cash for markets and auto rickshaws.

pages.title: What Festivals Are Celebrated in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Delhi celebrates dozens of festivals year-round, from Diwali and Holi to Republic Day and Eid. A month-by-month calendar with dates and tips for tourists.

pages.title: What Food Is Delhi Famous For?
pages.contentDirection: Delhi is famous for chaat, chole bhature, parathas, kebabs, butter chicken, and jalebis. Here's what to eat and exactly where to find it.

pages.title: Republic Day in Delhi — What To Expect
pages.contentDirection: Guide to Delhi's Republic Day parade on 26 January: how to get tickets, timing, security rules, and the week-long celebrations.

pages.title: What Is Agrasen Ki Baoli?
pages.contentDirection: Agrasen ki Baoli is a free-entry 14th-century stepwell near Connaught Place — one of Delhi's most atmospheric and photogenic spots.

pages.title: What Is Butter Chicken & Where Was It Invented?
pages.contentDirection: Butter chicken was invented in Delhi in 1947 by Kundan Lal Gujral at Moti Mahal in Daryaganj. Here's the origin story and where to eat it today.

pages.title: What Is Delhi Belly and How to Avoid It
pages.contentDirection: Delhi belly is traveller's diarrhea caused by unfamiliar bacteria in food or water. Drink bottled water, eat at busy stalls, and carry ORS sachets.

pages.title: What Is Delhi Best Known For?
pages.contentDirection: Delhi is best known for Mughal architecture, street food, seven ancient cities, and massive markets. Discover what defines India's capital.

pages.title: What Is Dilli Haat? Delhi's Crafts Bazaar
pages.contentDirection: Dilli Haat is an open-air handicrafts market with ₹30 entry, selling crafts from all Indian states plus regional street food. Near INA metro.

pages.title: What Is Mehrauli Archaeological Park?
pages.contentDirection: Mehrauli Archaeological Park has 200+ monuments from the 10th to 19th century in an overgrown forest next to Qutub Minar. Free entry, barely any tourists.

pages.title: What Is Paranthe Wali Gali?
pages.contentDirection: Paranthe Wali Gali is a famous Chandni Chowk alley serving stuffed parathas since the 1870s. Five shops, 30+ fillings, open mornings.

pages.title: What Is Surajkund Mela?
pages.contentDirection: Surajkund Mela is a two-week crafts fair near Delhi with handicrafts from every Indian state, regional food stalls, and cultural performances. Entry ₹180.

pages.title: What Is the Best Month to Visit Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: November and February are the best months to visit Delhi. November has post-monsoon freshness and Diwali. February brings mild weather and clear skies.

pages.title: What Is the Best Street Food in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Delhi's best street food includes golgappe, aloo tikki, chole kulche, ram ladoo, and dahi bhalle. Here are 15 dishes and where to find each one.

pages.title: What Is the Best Time to Visit Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: October to March is the best time to visit Delhi, with cool weather and clear skies. Avoid April-June (45C+). Season-by-season guide.

pages.title: What Is the Biggest Market in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Chandni Chowk is Delhi's biggest market and one of the largest in Asia. Built in the 1650s, each lane specialises in different goods.

pages.title: What Is the Most Visited Place in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Red Fort is Delhi's most visited monument with 3 million+ visitors yearly. Qutub Minar and India Gate complete the top three.

pages.title: What Is the Weather Like in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Delhi has extreme seasons — summers hit 45°C+, winters drop to 2°C, and monsoon brings heavy rain July-September. Month-by-month breakdown.

pages.title: What Language Do They Speak in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Hindi is Delhi's primary language. English is widely understood in tourist areas, hotels, and restaurants. Some Punjabi and Urdu are also spoken.

pages.title: What Should I Avoid in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Avoid street taxis, tap water, aggressive touts near tourist spots, and walking alone at night in quiet areas. Here's the full list with practical fixes.

pages.title: What Should I Pack for Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Pack light cotton for summer, warm layers for winter, modest clothing for temples, walking shoes, and a basic medical kit. Season-by-season packing list.

pages.title: What to Buy in Delhi as Souvenirs
pages.contentDirection: Spices from Khari Baoli, pashmina scarves, miniature paintings, brass items, Ayurvedic products, and Indian tea make the best Delhi souvenirs.

pages.title: Where Should I Stay in Delhi?
pages.contentDirection: Connaught Place for central access, South Delhi for safety and upscale dining, Karol Bagh for budget hotels, Paharganj for backpackers. Full area guide.

pages.title: Where to Buy Spices in Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Khari Baoli in Old Delhi is Asia's largest spice market. Buy whole spices at wholesale prices — a fraction of supermarket costs. Here's what to get.

pages.title: Where To Celebrate Holi in Delhi — 2026
pages.contentDirection: The best places to celebrate Holi in Delhi in 2026, from hotel parties to organic colour events. Safety tips, what to wear, and a Mathura day trip option.

pages.title: Where to Drink Craft Beer in Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Delhi's best craft beer spots include Bira 91 Taproom, Ek Bar, and Raasta in Hauz Khas. Expect to pay ₹300-600 per pint. Here's the full list.

pages.title: Where to Eat in Old Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Old Delhi's best food is at Karim's for kebabs, Paranthe Wali Gali for parathas, and Natraj for dahi bhalle. Here's a lane-by-lane eating guide.

pages.title: Where to Hear Live Sufi Music in Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Nizamuddin Dargah hosts free qawwali every Thursday evening starting around 6:30pm. Here's what to expect and where else to hear Sufi music.

pages.title: Mughal Architecture in Delhi — Complete Guide
pages.contentDirection: Delhi has over 100 Mughal-era monuments including Red Fort, Humayun's Tomb, and Jama Masjid. Entry fees, visiting tips, and a suggested route.

pages.title: Where to See Street Art in Delhi
pages.contentDirection: Lodhi Colony Art District has 50+ murals from international artists, all free and walkable. Here's how to explore Delhi's open-air gallery.

pages.title: Which Area in Delhi Has the Best Food?
pages.contentDirection: Old Delhi's Chandni Chowk has the best street food. Nizamuddin wins for Mughlai. Connaught Place for restaurants. Here's a neighbourhood food breakdown.

pages.title: Yoga Classes in Delhi for Tourists
pages.contentDirection: Drop-in yoga classes in Delhi cost ₹500-1,000 per session. Sivananda Yoga Centre, Yoga Kshema, and Hauz Khas studios welcome walk-ins.

pages.title: Things To Do In Delhi — 2026 Guide
pages.contentDirection: Complete guide to Delhi experiences including food tours, heritage walks, markets, and day trips. Prices in INR, honest local recommendations.
